title: Relates to state legislative ethics

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  KLEIN  -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Finance

       AN ACT to amend the public officers law, in relation to  state  legisla-
         tive ethics

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1.  Section 73 of the public officers law is amended by adding
    2  two new subdivisions 14-a and 14-b to read as follows:
    3    14-A. NOTWITHSTANDING THE PROVISIONS OF SUBDIVISION FOURTEEN  OF  THIS
    4  SECTION,  NO  MEMBER  OF  THE  LEGISLATURE  OR  LEGISLATIVE EMPLOYEE, AS
    5  DEFINED BY PARAGRAPH (D) OF SUBDIVISION ONE OF  SECTION  SEVENTY-THREE-A
    6  OF  THIS  ARTICLE,  SHALL  PARTICIPATE IN ANY DECISION TO HIRE, PROMOTE,
    7  PROCESS EMPLOYMENT PAPERWORK FOR OR HAVE KNOWLEDGE  OF  THE  PROSPECTIVE
    8  EMPLOYMENT  OR  CHANGE  OF  EMPLOYMENT  STATUS  OF  ANY RELATIVE FOR ANY
    9  COMPENSATED POSITION AT, FOR OR  WITHIN  THE  SAME  LEGISLATIVE  CHAMBER
   10  WHICH  EMPLOYS  SUCH  MEMBER  OR LEGISLATIVE EMPLOYEE. THE PROVISIONS OF
   11  THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL NOT APPLY TO PERSONS TO WHICH  PARAGRAPH  (B)  OF
   12  SUBDIVISION FOURTEEN OF THIS SECTION APPLIES.
   13    14-B.  IN ADDITION TO THE INFORMATION INCLUDED IN THE ANNUAL FINANCIAL
   14  STATEMENT   OF   FINANCIAL   DISCLOSURE   PROVIDED   FOR   IN    SECTION
   15  SEVENTY-THREE-A  OF  THIS  ARTICLE,  EVERY MEMBER OF THE LEGISLATURE AND
   16  LEGISLATIVE EMPLOYEE SHALL DISCLOSE THE NAMES OF ALL RELATIVES  WHO  ARE
   17  EMPLOYED BY THE LEGISLATURE AND THE DEGREE OF THEIR RELATIONSHIP.
   18    S 2. Paragraph d of subdivision 3 of section 74 of the public officers
   19  law,  as amended by chapter 1 of the laws of 2010, is amended to read as
   20  follows:
   21    d. No officer or employee of a state agency, member of the legislature
   22  or legislative employee should use or attempt to use his or her official
   23  position to secure unwarranted privileges or exemptions for  himself  or
   24  herself, HIS OR HER RELATIVE, AS DEFINED IN PARAGRAPH (M) OF SUBDIVISION

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04868-01-1

       S. 572                              2

    1  ONE  OF  SECTION SEVENTY-THREE OF THIS ARTICLE, or others, including but
    2  not limited to, the misappropriation to himself,  herself,  HIS  OR  HER
    3  RELATIVE,  AS  DEFINED  IN  PARAGRAPH  (M) OF SUBDIVISION ONE OF SECTION
    4  SEVENTY-THREE OF THIS ARTICLE, or to others of the property, services or
    5  other  resources  of the state for private business or other compensated
    6  non-governmental purposes.
    7    S 3. This act shall take effect on the ninetieth day  after  it  shall
    8  have become a law.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the public officers law, in relation to state legislative ethics
